meanings.def: a special chance to see or admire something

meanings.def: to have a particular aim, plan, etc. in your mind
examples: He wanted to make money and went abroad with this end in view.

meanings.def: to appear, especially when moving gradually closer from a long way off
examples: A ship hove into sight.
Like a galleon in full sail, Cara hove into view.

meanings.def: that can be seen completely, directly in front of somebody/something
examples: He was shot in full view of a large crowd.

meanings.def: considering something
examples: In view of the weather, the event will now be held indoors.

meanings.def: being shown in a public place so that people can look at it
examples: The new discoveries will be on view in London in the spring.

meanings.def: to think somebody/something is bad; to not have a good opinion of somebody/something

meanings.def: to consider what is likely to happen or be important over a long period of time rather than only considering the present situation

meanings.def: with the intention or hope of doing something
